article.headline: Niagara 84, Marist 59
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. (AP) -- Tremmell Darden scored 27 points to lead visiting Niagara to a 84-59 win over Marist Thursday night. Niagara jumped to an early lead and ran to a 43-21 lead at the half. The Purple Eagles shot 54.8 percent from the field and outrebounded Marist 24-18. The Red Foxes opened the second half with a 16-7 run, but Darden hit a 3-pointer to start an 11-4 spurt for Niagara (18-8, 12-4 MAAC). The run gave Niagara a 61-41 lead with 11:58 to play. James Reaves scored 15 points and grabbed a team-high 14 rebounds for Niagara. Juan Mendez added 14 points and David Brooks 12. Carl Hood led Marist (6-20, 4-13) with 14 points and seven rebounds. Will McClurkin added 11 points for the Red Foxes.
